quizzes.question: What is the index of the first element of the array?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Arrays[/h1]

An [b]array[/b] is a special variable, which can hold more than one value at a time.
If you have a list of items (a list of names, for example), storing them in single variables would look like this: [code format="php" ]$name1 = "David"; 
$name2 = "Amy"; 
$name3 = "John"; [/code]
But what if you have 100 names on your list? The solution: Create an [b]array[/b]!

[h2]Numeric Arrays[/h2]
Numeric or indexed arrays associate a numeric index with their values.
The index can be assigned automatically (index always starts at [b]0[/b]), like this: [code format="php" ]$names = [b]array[/b]("David", "Amy", "John");[/code]
As an alternative, you can assign your index manually.[code format="php" ]$names[b][0][/b] = "David";
$names[b][1][/b] = "Amy";
$names[b][2][/b] = "John";[/code]
We defined an array called [b]$names[/b] that stores three values.
You can access the array elements through their indices. [code format="php" codeId="472"]echo $names[1]; // Outputs "Amy"[/code]
[note]Remember that the first element in an array has the index of [b]0[/b], not 1.[/note]
